intro: Minuartia kashmirica, commonly known as Kashmir stonecrop, is a low-growing perennial plant belonging to the family Montiaceae. It is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves and small, star-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of white or pink. Native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas, this plant thrives in rocky and arid environments. It is well adapted to cold climates and can survive in poor soil conditions. Its unique morphology and ecological niche make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
